CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function unique_name_223 is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is because it directly includes the values of the 'out' object in the HTML response without properly sanitizing them. If an attacker can control the values in the 'out' object, they could inject malicious scripts that would be executed in the browser of anyone viewing the page. This could lead to a variety of attacks, such as stealing sensitive information or performing actions on behalf of the user.
